results.title: The Schoolmaster
results.brief_description: A portrait of a young schoolmaster who teachesz in a small country town in the Scottish hills. The film describes his home, his work, his relations with his pupils and their parents, and the affection and respect with which he is regarded. This film gives a intimate picture of the workings and atmosphere of a typical; school in Britain in a setting of traditional Scottish countryside.

results.title: The School of Stanley J. Ellis
results.brief_description:
A short history of Stanley J. Ellis (b. 1899), influential artisan and teacher in the field of decorative metalwork and enamelling whose intricate work represents some of the finest examples of craftsmanship to be produced in the arts and craft movement of early 20th century Australia. His work is permanently held at the Castlemaine Art Gallery and Museum in regional Victoria and in this film we see some of those highly acclaimed pieces. The film also features interviews with Peter Perry (Director, Castlemaine Art Gallery and Museum) and Beth Sinclair, one of Ellis’s students.
Filmed by Malcolm McKinnon and made in association with the Castlemaine Art Gallery and Museum.

results.title: The School of military engineering
results.brief_description: The instruction and training of engineers in the Australian Military Forces. Shows teaching facilities of the School of Military Engineering. Illustrates the jobs army engineers are required to do: the building of sewages disposal plants; demolition of bridges; the laying of land mines, also the detection and disposal of enemy mines.

results.title: The School nurse; Health examination of the school entrant
results.brief_description: Introduced by Debra Lawrance. Part 1 (7 min) provides an explanation of the overall role of the school nurse. Depicts the examination of the new school entrant, liaision between the school and parents and other community bodies. Part 2 (21min) illustrates the work done by the school nurse in assessing the health and well-being of new school entrants. Medical terminology is used in this verbally dense program.

results.title: The School is not an island
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Timothy Read, Malcolm Otton and Chris Noonan
results.brief_description: A group of students from Sunshine North Technical School in Melbourne, Victoria, attempt to start their own coffee shop as part of a community involvement program, and discover much about their ability to control their lives.

results.title: The School and the community
results.creator_credit: United Productions of America and McGraw-Hill Text-Films
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which emphasises one of the basic objectives of American public education today: the maintenance of schools that are an integral part of the community and that provide adequate training for future citizens.

results.title: The Sceptre and the mace
results.brief_description: During the 1957 opening of Canada’s 23rd parliament by Queen Elizabeth II, cameras record the ceremonies in the House of Commons and the Senate. They also bring to the screen many informal glimpses of the Queen and Prince Philip in residence at Government House.

results.title: The Scent of green papaya = l'odeur de la papaye verte
results.creator_credit: Christophe Rossignon, Productions Lazennec, SFP Cinema, La Sept Cinema and Tran Anh Hung
results.brief_description: Vietnam, 1950. Mui, a young country girl, joins a Saigon family as their servant and develops an enduring but secret attachment to Khuyen (Vuong Hoa Hoi), a friend of the eldest son. Some years later, when the family fortune declines and they can no longer afford to keep her, Mui (Nu Yen-Khe Tran), now 20, is sent to serve in the household of her childhood love who has now become a successful musician. Shot entirely in a French studio, Hung’s film is more concerned with the minute details of everyday Vietnamese life and the tones, colors, and feelings of a lost society. Hung casted non-professional actors, mostly Vietnamese living in Paris, who had to re-learn certain ritual gestures and Vietnamese language. His approach to this gentle world is reminiscent of Satyajit Ray and Ozu. He nudges the film forward by subtle, quiet strokes. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (1993): best First Feature Film for Tran Anh Hung ; Cannes Film Festival: Camera d’Or for Best First Film. Cast includes Nu Yen-Khe Tran, Truong Thi Loc and Nguyen Anh Hoa. In Vietnamese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Scene from Melbury House
results.brief_description: As a training exercise for their apprentice cameramen, British Transport Films used scrap lengths of film to record the varied daily lives of their neighbours as seen from the roof of their building in London’s Marylebone. A film without commentary featuring the music of Vaughan Williams. Nominated for a BAFTA award in 1974.
